title: "residual plot"
author: "Jie Zhao"
date: "November 17, 2016"
output: html_document
---

Here let's get the residual plot for Try4 experiment, which is 

```{r, echo=FALSE, eval=TRUE, message=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
market_name <- "panel_catt_daily"
df4residualPlot <- readRDS(paste0('C:\\work\\working materials\\Fr_univ_estimation\\02 Code\\01 outlier deletion\\Results\\2016-11-17 14.11.50\\df4residualPlot.RDS'))

```


```{r, echo=FALSE, include=TRUE}
# plot 1 
# -	X = Observed vs Y = Residual 
plot_title_1 <- paste0("Residual V.S. Observed Y (", market_name,"), with Survey variables")
ggplot(df4residualPlot , aes(x= Observe, y= Residual)) +  geom_point() + ggtitle(plot_title_1)


# plot 2
# -	X = Observed vs Y = RStudent
plot_title_2 <- paste0("Studentized Residuals V.S. Observed Y (", market_name,"), with Survey variables")
ggplot(df4residualPlot , aes(x= Observe, y= Studentized_residuals)) +  geom_point() + ggtitle(plot_title_2)

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
